btns_menus.builds.abc.check_for_Invoker(component, interaction: discord.interactions.Interaction) → bool[source]

Checks whether the author of the component and interaction are same or not

Parameters

  • component – Takes either button: SButton or dropmenu: SDropMenu

  • interaction – Takes interaction type discord.Interaction

Returns

bool, i.e [True, False]

class btns_menus.builds.button_.Btn(root: ClassVar, button: btns_menus.builds.button_.SButton)[source]

async callback(interaction: discord.interactions.Interaction)[source]

|coro|

The callback associated with this UI item.

This can be overridden by subclasses.

Parameters

interaction (Interaction) – The interaction that triggered this UI item.

class btns_menus.builds.button_.SButton(*, label: str, custom_id: typing.Optional[str] = None, disabled: bool = False, style: discord.enums.ButtonStyle = <ButtonStyle.secondary: 2>, url: typing.Optional[str] = None, emoji: typing.Optional[typing.Union[str, discord.emoji.Emoji, discord.partial_emoji.PartialEmoji]] = None, row: typing.Optional[int] = None, response: typing.Optional[typing.Union[str, discord.embeds.Embed]] = None, rewrite: bool = False, ephemeral: bool = False, delete_msg: bool = False, hidden: bool = False, author: typing.Optional[discord.member.Member] = None, verify: bool = True)[source]

async add_coro_func(function, *args, **kwargs)[source]

It’s an asynchronous function which stores same function type and adds the func to button for execution after getting clicked

  • args – takes args of the function provided by a user
